data.title: Trigger.dev | Open source background jobs with no timeouts.
data.description: Build and deploy reliable background jobs with no timeouts and no infrastructure to manage.
data.content:
Trigger.dev | Open source background jobs with no timeouts.
===============

[We're hiring engineers \- apply now](https://trigger.dev/careers)

Background jobs & AI infrastructure
===================================

Write workflows in normal async code and we'll handle the rest, from queues to elastic scaling. No timeouts, retries, observability, and zero infrastructure to manage.

[Get started now](https://cloud.trigger.dev/)[10.4k | Open source](https://github.com/triggerdotdev/trigger.dev)

![Image 7: Trigger.dev dashboard](https://trigger.dev/images/hero-image-dashboard.png)

AI tasks

Video processing

Cron

Waits

Workflows

AI Agent

Concurrency

Retries

PDF to images

Semantic search

Email campaign

// Generate an image using OpenAI Dall-E 3

export const generateContent \= task({

  id: "generate-content",

  retry: {

    maxAttempts: 3,

  },

  run: async ({ theme, description }: Payload) \=\> {

    const textResult \= await openai.chat.completions.create({

      model: "gpt-4o",

      messages: generateTextPrompt(theme, description),

    });

    if (!textResult.choices\[0\]) {

      throw new Error("No content, retrying…");

    }

    const imageResult \= await openai.images.generate({

      model: "dall-e-3",

      prompt: generateImagePrompt(theme, description),

    });

    if (!imageResult.data\[0\]) {

      throw new Error("No image, retrying…");

    }

    return {

      text: textResult.choices\[0\],

      image: imageResult.data\[0\].url,

    };

  },

});

Reliably call AI APIs with no timeouts, automatic retrying, and tracing. Use existing Node.js SDKs and code from your repo.

[Learn more about AI tasks](https://trigger.dev/docs/guides/ai-agents/overview)

Trusted by developers at companies all over the world
-----------------------------------------------------

How Trigger.dev works
---------------------

Play

Replay

Full screen

Build invincible AI apps
------------------------

Offload your async AI tasks to our infrastructure. Create AI agents and stream responses directly to your frontend.

[![Image 8: Prompt chaining](https://trigger.dev/images/ai-agents/prompt-chaining.png) ### Prompt chaining Chain AI prompts together to create multi-stage processing flows. View example](https://trigger.dev/docs/guides/ai-agents/generate-translate-copy)

[![Image 9: Routing](https://trigger.dev/images/ai-agents/routing.png) ### Routing Smart distribution of tasks to specialized AI models based on content analysis. View example](https://trigger.dev/docs/guides/ai-agents/route-question)

[![Image 10: Parallelization](https://trigger.dev/images/ai-agents/parallelization.png) ### Parallelization Concurrent execution of multiple AI tasks for simultaneous processing and analysis. View example](https://trigger.dev/docs/guides/ai-agents/respond-and-check-content)

[![Image 11: Orchestrator](https://trigger.dev/images/ai-agents/orchestrator.png) ### Orchestrator Coordinate multiple AI agents to achieve complex objectives. View example](https://trigger.dev/docs/guides/ai-agents/verify-news-article)

[![Image 12: Evaluator-optimizer](https://trigger.dev/images/ai-agents/evaluator-optimizer.png) ### Evaluator-optimizer Iterative feedback system that continuously evaluates and refines AI outputs. View example](https://trigger.dev/docs/guides/ai-agents/translate-and-refine)

Deploy and scale to any size
----------------------------

### No timeouts

Write simple, reliable code and never hit a timeout.

### Pay for what you use

Only pay when your code is actually executing.

### No servers to manage

We deploy your tasks and handle scaling for you.

Find and fix bugs fast
----------------------

### Alerts for errors

Get notified via email, Slack or webhooks when your tasks or deployments fail.

![Image 13: hero](https://trigger.dev/patterns/alerts-bg.png)

### Advanced filtering

Find runs fast using advanced filtering options, then apply bulk actions to multiple tasks at once.

![Image 14: hero](https://trigger.dev/patterns/alerts-bg.png)

### Versioning

Each deploy is an atomic version ensuring started tasks are not affected by code changes.

![Image 15: hero](https://trigger.dev/patterns/alerts-bg.png)

All the tools you need to ship
------------------------------

[View all features](https://trigger.dev/product)

### Development

### Production

[### Concurrency controls](https://trigger.dev/product/concurrency-and-queues)

[### Multiple environments](https://trigger.dev/docs/how-it-works#dev-mode)[### No servers to manage](https://trigger.dev/docs/how-it-works#trigger-dev-architecture)[### Automatic retries](https://trigger.dev/docs/errors-retrying)[### Build extensions](https://trigger.dev/docs/config/extensions/overview#build-extensions)[### Checkpointing](https://trigger.dev/docs/how-it-works#the-checkpoint-resume-system)[### Versioning](https://trigger.dev/docs/versioning)

### Observability

[### Live dashboard](https://trigger.dev/product/observability-and-monitoring)

[### Easily test tasks](https://trigger.dev/docs/run-tests#run-tests)[### Tags](https://trigger.dev/docs/tags#tags)

[### Run metadata](https://trigger.dev/docs/runs/metadata#run-metadata)

[### Custom alerts](https://trigger.dev/product/observability-and-monitoring#alerts)

Reliable by default
-------------------

[Docs](https://trigger.dev/docs/v3/errors-retrying)

#### Task retrying

Configure automatic retrying for tasks.

#### handleError()

Conditional retrying based on the error and run.

#### retry.onThrow()

Fine-grained retrying inside tasks.

#### retry.fetch()

Automatically retry requests based on the response.

#### trigger.config

Configure default retrying in your config file.

import { task } from "@trigger.dev/sdk/v3";

export const simpleTask \= task({

  id: "simple-task",

  retry: {

    maxAttempts: 3,

    minTimeoutInMs: 1000,

    maxTimeoutInMs: 5000,

    factor: 2,

    randomize: true,

  },

  run: async (payload, { ctx }) \=\> {

    logger.log(\`Attempt ${ctx.attempt.number}\`);

    try {

      throw new Error("This is an error.");

    } catch (error) {

      // The error was caught, so no retry

    }

    throw new Error("This will cause a retry.");

  },

});

### Ready to start building?

Build and deploy your first task in 3 mins with no timeouts and no infrastructure to manage.

[Get started for free](https://cloud.trigger.dev/)

#### Simple pricing

Only pay for what you use and scale with your needs.

[Explore pricing](https://trigger.dev/pricing)

#### Self-host

Trigger.dev is open source and self-hostable.

[Self-hosting docs](https://trigger.dev/docs/v3/open-source-self-hosting)
